trial_identification.studytitle: Skill level and body orientation affect infants' reaching
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of skill level and body orientations on infant reaching

conditions.healthcondition: Evaluation of proximal and distal adjustments of reaching in healthy infants positioned in supine, reclined and seated body orientation

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Research that is not of generic health relevance and not applicable to specific health categories listed above

interventions.interventions: Ten infants classified as less-skilled and more-skilled reachers were evaluated both at the acquisition of reaching and after one month of spontaneous practice in three different body orientations: supine, reclined and seated positions. The infant was positioned in a baby chair. In each position, before starting the toy presentation, a 20seconds interval was allowed for infant to get used to the position. The first toy was offered for 2 minutes at the infant's midline, at shoulders height. After reach, the toy was taken away and presented again. The same procedure was follow with a second toy. The total time of the experiment was about 13 min.

primaryOutcome.outcome: higher frequency of unimanual reaching in seated position and hands next to the body in reclined and seated positions for less-skilled reachers
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Acquisition of reaching, i.e. in the first lab visit in which reaching occurred (at 4- or 5-month-old).

primaryOutcome.outcome: higher frequencies of unimanual reaches (supine and seated), and hands next to the body (reclined) for less-skilled reachers. More reaches followed by grasping (seated) and hands away from the body (supine) for more-skilled reachers.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: After one month of spontaneous practice, i.e. during the subsequent lab visit after reaching ocurred (5- or 6-month-old).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: 60% of less-skilled reachers and 40% of more-skilled reachers
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: acquisition of reaching, i. e. in the first lab visit in which reaching ocurred (4- or 5-month-old)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: healthy full term infants; Apgar score of greater than or equal to 8 at the first and fifth minutes; and legal consent from the partcicpants' parents.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Rodovia Washington Luis, km 235 13565-905 Sao Carlos - SP

fundingsource.fundingname: Foundation for the Coordination of Higher Education and Graduate Training (CAPES foundation)

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Rodovia Washington Luis, km 235 13565-905 Sao Carlos SP

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of this study is to verify how different body orientations affect proximal and distal reaching adjustments in 4-to6-month-old.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Research Ethics Commitee of University Federal of Sao Carlos
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Rodovia Washington Luis, km 235 Sao Carlos SP
